trans-unit.source: Tomcat on a virtual machine | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tomcat on a virtual machine | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create a Windows Virtual machine and configure the machine to run a Apache Tomcat application server.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create a Windows Virtual machine and configure the machine to run a Apache Tomcat application server.

trans-unit.source: How to run a Java application server on a virtual machine
trans-unit.target: How to run a Java application server on a virtual machine

trans-unit.source: With Azure, you can use a virtual machine to provide server capabilities.
trans-unit.target: With Azure, you can use a virtual machine to provide server capabilities.

trans-unit.source: As an example, a virtual machine running on Azure can be configured to host a Java application server, such as Apache Tomcat.
trans-unit.target: As an example, a virtual machine running on Azure can be configured to host a Java application server, such as Apache Tomcat.

trans-unit.source: After you complete this guide, you will have an understanding of how to create a virtual machine running on Azure and configure it to run a Java application server.
trans-unit.target: After you complete this guide, you will have an understanding of how to create a virtual machine running on Azure and configure it to run a Java application server.

trans-unit.source: You will learn:
trans-unit.target: You will learn:

trans-unit.source: How to create a virtual machine that has a Java Development Kit (JDK) already installed.
trans-unit.target: How to create a virtual machine that has a Java Development Kit (JDK) already installed.

trans-unit.source: How to remotely sign in to your virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: How to remotely sign in to your virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: How to install a Java application server on your virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: How to install a Java application server on your virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: How to create an endpoint for your virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: How to create an endpoint for your virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: How to open a port in the firewall for your application server.
trans-unit.target: How to open a port in the firewall for your application server.

trans-unit.source: For the purposes of this tutorial, an Apache Tomcat application server will be installed on a virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: For the purposes of this tutorial, an Apache Tomcat application server will be installed on a virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: The completed installation will result in a Tomcat installation such as the following.
trans-unit.target: The completed installation will result in a Tomcat installation such as the following.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Virtual machine running Apache Tomcat</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Virtual machine running Apache Tomcat</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To create a virtual machine
trans-unit.target: To create a virtual machine

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the <link><linkText>Azure portal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the <link><linkText>Azure portal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Click New, click Compute, click Virtual machine, and then click From Gallery.
trans-unit.target: Click New, click Compute, click Virtual machine, and then click From Gallery.

trans-unit.source: In the Virtual machine image select dialog box, select JDK 7 Windows Server 2012.
trans-unit.target: In the Virtual machine image select dialog box, select JDK 7 Windows Server 2012.

trans-unit.source: Note that JDK 6 Windows Server 2012 is available if you have legacy applications that are not ready to run in JDK 7.
trans-unit.target: Note that JDK 6 Windows Server 2012 is available if you have legacy applications that are not ready to run in JDK 7.

trans-unit.source: Click Next.
trans-unit.target: Click Next.

trans-unit.source: In the Virtual machine configuration dialog box:
trans-unit.target: In the Virtual machine configuration dialog box:

trans-unit.source: Specify a name for the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Specify a name for the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Specify the size to use for the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Specify the size to use for the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Enter a name for the administrator in the User Name field.
trans-unit.target: Enter a name for the administrator in the User Name field.

trans-unit.source: Remember this name and the password you will enter next, you will use them when you remotely sign in to the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Remember this name and the password you will enter next, you will use them when you remotely sign in to the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Enter a password in the New password field, and re-enter it in the Confirm field.
trans-unit.target: Enter a password in the New password field, and re-enter it in the Confirm field.

trans-unit.source: This is the Administrator account password.
trans-unit.target: This is the Administrator account password.

trans-unit.source: Click Next.
trans-unit.target: Click Next.

trans-unit.source: In the next Virtual machine configuration dialog box:
trans-unit.target: In the next Virtual machine configuration dialog box:

trans-unit.source: For Cloud service, use the default Create a new cloud service.
trans-unit.target: For Cloud service, use the default Create a new cloud service.

trans-unit.source: The value for Cloud service DNS name must be unique across cloudapp.net.
trans-unit.target: The value for Cloud service DNS name must be unique across cloudapp.net.

trans-unit.source: If needed, modify this value so that Azure indicates it is unique.
trans-unit.target: If needed, modify this value so that Azure indicates it is unique.

trans-unit.source: Specify a region, affinity group, or virtual network.
trans-unit.target: Specify a region, affinity group, or virtual network.

trans-unit.source: For the purposes of this tutorial, specify a region such as West US.
trans-unit.target: For the purposes of this tutorial, specify a region such as West US.

trans-unit.source: For Storage Account, select Use an automatically generated storage account.
trans-unit.target: For Storage Account, select Use an automatically generated storage account.

trans-unit.source: For Availability Set, select (None).
trans-unit.target: For Availability Set, select (None).

trans-unit.source: Click Next.
trans-unit.target: Click Next.

trans-unit.source: In the final Virtual machine configuration dialog box:
trans-unit.target: In the final Virtual machine configuration dialog box:

trans-unit.source: Accept the default endpoint entries.
trans-unit.target: Accept the default endpoint entries.

trans-unit.source: Click Complete.
trans-unit.target: Click Complete.

trans-unit.source: To remotely sign in to your virtual machine
trans-unit.target: To remotely sign in to your virtual machine

trans-unit.source: Log on to the <link><linkText>Management portal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Log on to the <link><linkText>Management portal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Click Virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: Click Virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: Click the name of the virtual machine that you want to sign in to.
trans-unit.target: Click the name of the virtual machine that you want to sign in to.

trans-unit.source: After the virtual machine has started, a pop-up menu at the bottom of the page allows connections.
trans-unit.target: After the virtual machine has started, a pop-up menu at the bottom of the page allows connections.

trans-unit.source: Click Connect.
trans-unit.target: Click Connect.

trans-unit.source: Respond to the prompts as needed to connect to the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Respond to the prompts as needed to connect to the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: This should entail saving or opening the .rdp file that contains the connection details.
trans-unit.target: This should entail saving or opening the .rdp file that contains the connection details.

trans-unit.source: You might have to copy the url:port as the last part of the first line of the .rdp file and paste it in a remote sign-in application.
trans-unit.target: You might have to copy the url:port as the last part of the first line of the .rdp file and paste it in a remote sign-in application.

trans-unit.source: To install a Java application server on your virtual machine
trans-unit.target: To install a Java application server on your virtual machine

trans-unit.source: You can copy a Java application server to your virtual machine, or you can install a Java application server through an installer.
trans-unit.target: You can copy a Java application server to your virtual machine, or you can install a Java application server through an installer.

trans-unit.source: For the purposes of this tutorial, Tomcat will be installed.
trans-unit.target: For the purposes of this tutorial, Tomcat will be installed.

trans-unit.source: When you are signed in to your virtual machine, open a browser session to <link><linkText>Apache Tomcat</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: When you are signed in to your virtual machine, open a browser session to <link><linkText>Apache Tomcat</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Double-click the link for 32-bit/64-bit Windows Service Installer.
trans-unit.target: Double-click the link for 32-bit/64-bit Windows Service Installer.

trans-unit.source: By using this technique, Tomcat will be installed as a Windows service.
trans-unit.target: By using this technique, Tomcat will be installed as a Windows service.

trans-unit.source: When prompted, choose to run the installer.
trans-unit.target: When prompted, choose to run the installer.

trans-unit.source: Within the Apache Tomcat Setup wizard, follow the prompts to install Tomcat.
trans-unit.target: Within the Apache Tomcat Setup wizard, follow the prompts to install Tomcat.

trans-unit.source: For the purposes of this tutorial, accepting the defaults is fine.
trans-unit.target: For the purposes of this tutorial, accepting the defaults is fine.

trans-unit.source: When you reach the Completing the Apache Tomcat Setup Wizard dialog box, you can optionally check Run Apache Tomcat to have Tomcat start now.
trans-unit.target: When you reach the Completing the Apache Tomcat Setup Wizard dialog box, you can optionally check Run Apache Tomcat to have Tomcat start now.

trans-unit.source: Click Finish to complete the Tomcat setup process.
trans-unit.target: Click Finish to complete the Tomcat setup process.

trans-unit.source: To start Tomcat
trans-unit.target: To start Tomcat

trans-unit.source: If you did not choose to run Tomcat in the Completing the Apache Tomcat Setup Wizard dialog box, start it by opening a command prompt on your virtual machine and running net start Tomcat7.
trans-unit.target: If you did not choose to run Tomcat in the Completing the Apache Tomcat Setup Wizard dialog box, start it by opening a command prompt on your virtual machine and running net start Tomcat7.

trans-unit.source: You should now see Tomcat running if you run the virtual machine's browser and open <html></html>.
trans-unit.target: You should now see Tomcat running if you run the virtual machine's browser and open <html></html>.

trans-unit.source: To see Tomcat running from external machines, you need to create an endpoint and open a port.
trans-unit.target: To see Tomcat running from external machines, you need to create an endpoint and open a port.

trans-unit.source: To create an endpoint for your virtual machine
trans-unit.target: To create an endpoint for your virtual machine

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the <link><linkText>Management portal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the <link><linkText>Management portal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Click Virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: Click Virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: Click the name of the virtual machine that is running your Java application server.
trans-unit.target: Click the name of the virtual machine that is running your Java application server.

trans-unit.source: Click Endpoints.
trans-unit.target: Click Endpoints.

trans-unit.source: Click Add.
trans-unit.target: Click Add.

trans-unit.source: In the Add endpoint dialog box, ensure Add standalone endpoint is selected, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: In the Add endpoint dialog box, ensure Add standalone endpoint is selected, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: In the New endpoint details dialog box:
trans-unit.target: In the New endpoint details dialog box:

trans-unit.source: Specify a name for the endpoint; for example, HttpIn.
trans-unit.target: Specify a name for the endpoint; for example, HttpIn.

trans-unit.source: Specify TCP for the protocol.
trans-unit.target: Specify TCP for the protocol.

trans-unit.source: Specify 80 for the public port.
trans-unit.target: Specify 80 for the public port.

trans-unit.source: Specify 8080 for the private port.
trans-unit.target: Specify 8080 for the private port.

trans-unit.source: Click the Complete button to close the dialog box.
trans-unit.target: Click the Complete button to close the dialog box.

trans-unit.source: Your endpoint will now be created.
trans-unit.target: Your endpoint will now be created.

trans-unit.source: To open a port in the firewall for your virtual machine
trans-unit.target: To open a port in the firewall for your virtual machine

trans-unit.source: Sign in to your virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to your virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Click Windows Start.
trans-unit.target: Click Windows Start.

trans-unit.source: Click Control Panel.
trans-unit.target: Click Control Panel.

trans-unit.source: Click System and Security, click Windows Firewall, and then click Advanced Settings.
trans-unit.target: Click System and Security, click Windows Firewall, and then click Advanced Settings.

trans-unit.source: Click Inbound Rules, and then click New Rule.
trans-unit.target: Click Inbound Rules, and then click New Rule.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New inbound rule</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New inbound rule</linkText>

trans-unit.source: For the Rule Type, select Port, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: For the Rule Type, select Port, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New inbound rule port</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New inbound rule port</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Protocol and Ports screen, select TCP, specify 8080 as the Specific local port, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Protocol and Ports screen, select TCP, specify 8080 as the Specific local port, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New inbound rule </linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New inbound rule </linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Action screen, select Allow the connection, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Action screen, select Allow the connection, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New inbound rule action</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New inbound rule action</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Profile screen, ensure that Domain, Private, and Public are selected, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Profile screen, ensure that Domain, Private, and Public are selected, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New inbound rule profile</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New inbound rule profile</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Name screen, specify a name for the rule, such as HttpIn (the rule name is not required to match the endpoint name, however), and then click Finish.
trans-unit.target: On the Name screen, specify a name for the rule, such as HttpIn (the rule name is not required to match the endpoint name, however), and then click Finish.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New inbound rule name</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New inbound rule name</linkText>

trans-unit.source: At this point, your Tomcat website should be viewable from an external browser by using a URL of the form http://*your\_DNS\_name*.cloudapp.net, where *your\_DNS\_name* is the DNS name you specified when you created the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: At this point, your Tomcat website should be viewable from an external browser by using a URL of the form http://*your\_DNS\_name*.cloudapp.net, where *your\_DNS\_name* is the DNS name you specified when you created the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Application lifecycle considerations
trans-unit.target: Application lifecycle considerations

trans-unit.source: You could create your own web application archive (WAR) and add it to the webapps folder.
trans-unit.target: You could create your own web application archive (WAR) and add it to the webapps folder.

trans-unit.source: For example, create a basic Java Service Page (JSP) dynamic web project and export it as a WAR file, copy the WAR to the Apache Tomcat webapps folder on the virtual machine, then run it in a browser.
trans-unit.target: For example, create a basic Java Service Page (JSP) dynamic web project and export it as a WAR file, copy the WAR to the Apache Tomcat webapps folder on the virtual machine, then run it in a browser.

trans-unit.source: By default when the Tomcat service is installed, it is set to start manually.
trans-unit.target: By default when the Tomcat service is installed, it is set to start manually.

trans-unit.source: You can switch it to start automatically by using the Services snap-in.
trans-unit.target: You can switch it to start automatically by using the Services snap-in.

trans-unit.source: Start the Services snap-in by clicking Windows Start, Administrative Tools, and then Services.
trans-unit.target: Start the Services snap-in by clicking Windows Start, Administrative Tools, and then Services.

trans-unit.source: Double-click the Apache Tomcat service and set Startup type to Automatic.
trans-unit.target: Double-click the Apache Tomcat service and set Startup type to Automatic.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Setting a service to start automatically</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Setting a service to start automatically</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The benefit of having Tomcat start automatically is that it will start if the virtual machine is rebooted (for example, after software updates that require a reboot are installed).
trans-unit.target: The benefit of having Tomcat start automatically is that it will start if the virtual machine is rebooted (for example, after software updates that require a reboot are installed).

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Learn about other services (such as Azure Storage, service bus, and SQL Database) that you may want to include with your Java applications by viewing the information available at the <link><linkText>Java Developer Center</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Learn about other services (such as Azure Storage, service bus, and SQL Database) that you may want to include with your Java applications by viewing the information available at the <link><linkText>Java Developer Center</linkText><title></title></link>.
